## ResourceCandidate.validateResourceTypes() method

Extracts the [resource type](./ts-res.resourcetypes.resourcetype.md) from a list of [resource candidates](./ts-res.resources.resourcecandidate.md)<!-- -->, if present.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static validateResourceTypes(candidates: ReadonlyArray<ResourceCandidate>, expectedType?: ResourceType): Result<ResourceType | undefined>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

candidates


</td><td>

ReadonlyArray&lt;[ResourceCandidate](./ts-res.resourcecandidate.md)<!-- -->&gt;


</td><td>

The list of candidates from which to extract the resource type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

expectedType


</td><td>

[ResourceType](./ts-res.resourcetype.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Result&lt;[ResourceType](./ts-res.resourcetype.md) \| undefined&gt;

`Success` with the resource type if successful, `Success` with `undefined` if none of the candidates specify a resource tap, and `Failure` with an error message if clients specify conflicting resource types.
